content: प्रणी {c1c} <ab>P.</ab> {@--1@} To lead out or forth (as an army), conduct; वानरेंद्रेण प्रणीतेन (वलेन) <ls>Rām.</ls> {@--2@} To offer, give, present; अर्घ्यं प्रणीय जनकात्मजा <ls>Bk. 5. 76.</ls> {@--3@} To bring to, set (as fire); <ls>Pt. 3. 1.</ls> {@--4@} To consecrate by reciting sacred Mantras, hallow, consecrate in general; त्रिधा प्रणीतो ज्वलनः <ls>Hariv.</ls> {@--5@} To inflict (as punishment); <ls>Ms. 7. 20</ls>; <ls n="Ms.">8. 238.</ls> {@--6@} To lay down, teach, promulgate, institute, prescribe; स एव धर्मो मनुना प्रणीतः <ls>R. 14. 67</ls>; भवत्प्रणीतमाचारमामनंति हि साधवः <ls>Ku. 6. 31.</ls> {@--7@} To write, compose (as a work); प्रणीतः न तु प्रकाशितः <ls>U. 4</ls>; उत्तरं रामचरितं तत्प्रणीतं प्रयुज्यते <ls>U. 1. 3.</ls> {@--8@} To accomplish, effect, perform, bring about; <ls>N. 1. 15</ls>, <ls n="N. 1.">19</ls>; <ls>Bh. 3. 82.</ls> {@--9@} To lead or reduce to any condition. {@--10@} To show, display. {@--11@} To direct, fix or turn towards (as the eyes). {@--12@} To show affection or love, love. {@--13@} To throw, cast, discharge. {@--14@} To remove, destroy. {@--15@} To draw in the breath (<ab>Atm.</ab>).
